intro: Prionanthium pholiuroides, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in wet forest habitats and is often found in shaded, moist environments. It has small, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
